column1: Agandaûr is one of the main characters and antagonist of The Lord of the Rings: War in the North. He is a descendant of the Black Númenóreans and Saurons most cruel servant. He was both a mighty Magic and warrior
column2: being able to fight Elladan and Elrohir at the same time.The Lord of the Rings: War in the North
aswell as most of his personal details
column3: are unknown. He must have started to serve Sauron somewhere in the Third Age. Agandaûr became a great warrior and sorcerer
column4: likely being taught by Sauron himself.

column1: File:The Lord of the Rings War in the North - Agandaûr fights Elladan and Elrohir.jpg and Elrohir.At the same time that the Nazgûl were sent to retrieve the One Ring
column2: Agandaûr was sent north to conquer Eriador and destroy Rivendell. He assembled an army in Fornost of Orcs of the Misty Mountains.The Lord of the Rings: War in the North
column3: Prologue In Fornost he took Tharzog
column4: chieftain of the Orcs of Mount Gram
column5: into his service and passed his knowledge of sorcery to the Orcs.

column1: Just shortly after the Nazgûl defeated the Rangers of the North at Sarn Ford
column2: Agandaûr met there with the Witch-king. Telling him he had finished the preparations and was ready to attack
column3: as assistance for the Nine Riders in the Hunt of the Ring. The Witch-king ordered him to return and attack immediately.
